From the start, Karen was attentive to my questions about the place, and it was easy to settle into the place. I was going to her place to study for the bar, with my Mom, and the place was perfect for that. There were theater chairs with tables that can be added to them, that allowed me to lay down and relax, or to study in quiet or with a Netflix movie going. The carpet was a cozy soft carpet, and the bets were very easy to fall asleep in. The bathroom and shower were clean and had everything you needed to wash off with. Karen was exceptionally kind and gave us great ideas on what to do in the city and how to get to certain places. The place was perfect and the stay was perfect.

Rest, Cleanliness, Warmth, Faith, Rejuvenation,...This is what you can expect when you stay at S&K Getaway. I was apprehensive at first staying in another personâ€™s home, especially with 4 kids, 4-12 years in age, but Iâ€™m glad I trusted my wife. We enjoyed every minute of our short getaway where we just wanted family time before school starts. The pictures do not do it justice and neither will this review. The pool was perfect with plenty of outdoor space and different settings to relax. The perfect location for us to unplug and to enjoy each other as a family. You can enjoy a walk down a country road where life is slower and no cars. The sunset over the fields are what pictures are made of. If you do need anything, town is less than 10 minutes away. Highly recommend, you wonâ€™t be disappointed, they set the bar high for our first AirBnB.
Thank you Steve and Karan for a relaxing few days, we truly enjoyed our conversations. May God continue to bless you and your family!

The home was lovely, very peaceful and you are able to clearly see the beautiful sunset and sunrise here. The home itself is very cozy !!
The Cornhole game was a lot of fun! My family enjoyed the back deck and the shower also( waterfall type)! The host was very thoughtful in adding things to do, some great favorite movies on dvd, board games etc.
The owner/host was very friendly and helpful and answered questions promptly!
The only few downsides were that there were so many flies, many dead and living flies inside the home, in windows seals, on the curtains and on the floors. There were plug in nightlites (large ones) that I assume we're there to attract the flies. I had a hard time sleeping because I could hear the flies buzzing around in the room. There were flies on the floors that would spin around, on the countertops as well. This was the only problem that we had and it was becoming stressful to deal with. We did spend a lot of time using the flyswatter to kill flies.

1 adult had mobility challenges so downstairs bedroom & bathroom was perfect!
Children LOVED the â€œsecretâ€ knee wall storage upstairs & had more fun making forts than anything else!
Children all enjoyed their â€œsleep overâ€ in the upstairs room with the 2 x double beds.
The main upstairs large bed was perfect for the â€œsentry guardâ€â€™parent!
Small room off to the side (no privacy door) with the single bed was perfect for an adult or older child.
PLENTY of space!
Kitchen was FULLY stocked with everything we needed to cook, refrigerate and clean!
Open plan space with table and barstools was perfect for family meals.
Sliding door onto porch with stunning view of fields was perfect for sitting and enjoying the stillness and peace - even in November (the adults drank their coffee and ate breakfast outside one morning together!)
Bathroom comes with washer and dryer. Helps you travel light.
TV & WiFi great.

review_text: We stayed at Chuck and Carol's farmhouse while visiting family in the area. We loved the home and property. There was plenty of space for our family of 4, and our kids were so happy to find a bunch of toys, games and DVDs ready to play with once we arrived. This was the most well-stocked Airbnb I've ever stayed at -- tons of extra towels, lots of things already in the kitchen to help with cooking, and they even had some coffee, cereal and chips available for guests. We found the property to be so peaceful. I loved opening the doors in the dining area and seeing the birds and miles of green space. We even saw two adorable bunnies a couple times that were chasing each other around. The beds and linens were so comfortable. The only downside was there is only one bathroom, and it's on the first floor, but we made do. :) Thanks for the wonderful stay, and for your friendly welcome, Kim! We wouldn't hesitate to book it again if we were to return to the area.

Something that could be easy to take for granted is hot water, and with the amount of people we had here, we never ran out of hot water in the shower.
Two things I wish they had here would have been a vacuum cleaner and an actual coffee maker rather than a Keurig, and those would be our groups only complaints.
We enjoyed our stay here very much and it was easy to gather together in the living room areas or on the porch for playing card games and chatting together.

review_text:
Magical, quiet country farm. We stayed with two kids and 3 grown-ups and it felt like we had plenty of room. There are 4 sleeping areas. The house is located in South Charleston Ohio, a small agricultural community. Yellow Springs Ohio and Glen Helen nature preserve is a 20 minute drive away on pleasant country roads.
The house is clean. The kitchen is large and had cereal, chips and some drinks available. The kitchen and dining room has large windows which show the view of the sunrise on the farm fields. Walking trail off the house which passes a babbling brook.
When we were there the property manager lived in a camper in the barn so was available to answer questions. On our last day she took 20-30 minutes to show the kids the chickens, dogs and cows. The kids harvested eggs.

The rooms in the house are spacious; we really appreciated the large, fully appointed kitchen and dining area. There was a large screen TV for the football fans among us, and plenty of bedroom space for the littles who are still nappers (including cribs.) Kim greeted us like old friends. The only thing I thought I was going to miss by not having our celebration at home was the Christmas cheer--imagine my surprise when we walked in to see a fully decorated tree, spice-scented air, and cute Christmas decor and pillows. The hosts really go the extra mile for guests! Can't wait to come back when the weather is not so cold!

review_text:
Chuck and Carol's place was great. Peaceful and serene; so much to explore. It was a bit buggy so we didn't do that much exploring by the pond as we wanted to, but beautiful nonetheless. The house was clean, the blankets and pillows were super comfortable.
The one thing that threw me off was the four bedrooms listed. Upstairs, there is a separate bedroom with 2 full beds; and then there is a queen bed and a daybed (maybe single bed) in what I would call a nook. This nook is the best spot in the house, with the best views out of the super big windows. This wasn't bad, it just wasn't what I was expecting.
There were so many extras available. If you forgot anything, they had it. Snacks and coffee were stocked in the kitchen for us, as well as extra stuff in the bathroom.
This was a lovely place.

review_text: We stayed here for one night on our cross country road trip. The house is nice, the porch is wonderful, and the property is beautiful. It was a nice place to relax on our adventure. There were a few small issues with the cleanliness (dust, dead flies, etc). The walk along the trail to the pond was beautiful... just be aware that it's near tall grass, and we found several ticks on our clothes and on ourselves during and after the walk (to be expected in that environment, just something to be aware of). But the hosts and property manager were very friendly, and we were happy to include this stop on our journey.

review_text: This property is the perfect place to let kids run & play, great trails for easy walking, nice fire pit, lots of good snacks provided,owners were very friendly & fast to respond & helped with any issues we had. We got invited over to the barn to let my 3 boys play in the loft & pet their sweet pups! We had an issue with the tv & DVD player & it was promptly fixed & we even got a new DVD player hooked up! Only a few minor things that we suggest to increase the pleasure of the stay. Having a tv in the master bedroom even just a small one would have been great. Possibly a small sectional, bigger couch or even adding 2 recliners downstairs would be great. Possibly an upgraded more firm mattress in the master would be great too! The outside light never goes off & is extremely bright. It took away from the beautiful night sky & enjoyment at the fire. These things are all minor & we still had an amazing time! If youâ€™re looking for for a serene getaway with tons of great outdoor space this is your place!

She has a wonderful setup in the dining room for breakfast complete with a refrigerator full of anything you may need for your coffee or tea. She even provided homemade granola that was very tasty, in addition to packaged granola bars and fruit. The location was just about 18 minutes from Ohio Christian University, which was an easy drive in the morning. We will definitely consider staying here again! Thank you, Laura, for everything!

She is one of the most attentive hosts I have come across in my BnB experience. The morning I left I was served one of the best breakfasts I've ever had while on the road. If you're traveling I-70 through Ohio, it's worth the 45 minute drop south (at Columbus) to stay here. And you'll enjoy that drive! Highly recommended!

review_text: This is a charming house in a charming neighborhood. The place was very clean and smelled good. I'd say it was cleaner than most hotels. The amenities were 5 stars. There was Starbucks coffee for the Kureg, toothbrush kits, sewing kits, there was even some crushed red pepper for the pizza I ordered. The list goes on too. There are bikes in the shed to use on the nice bike trail that runs behind the house and a fire pit and chairs outside. The neighborhood reminded me of the small town I grew up in including the train whistling as it comes through town. I felt safe and it was a quiet, calm setting. This place will exceed your expectations! Not to mention the world-class pizza just a few blocks away at the Purple Monkey. If I'm ever in the area again I'll definitely stay here. A big thank-you to Rachel!

name: Jim
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Absolutely perfect!!
We stay in a lot of AirBNB and I have to say this was probably one of the best little get-a-ways we have had. The house is small but makes perfect use of the space. It had everything we could have needed or wanted. Super clean, comfortable bed and couch, a great porch to sit and enjoy coffee, a firepit that they provided wood for, a grill, a Keurig with some K-cups just in case you forgot them.
They thought of everything and although we brought what we needed it was very thoughtful that they had so many little extras just in case... pop-tarts if you needed a quick breakfast, popcorn for a night cuddled with your honey, cotton balls and q-tips in the bathroom, every kitchen item you would need along with cooking oil just in case...my goodness everywhere you turned if you had forgotten something somehow they had a small amount to get you thru. I was impressed.
There are bikes in the garage and a biking path that runs right past the back of the property.
The place in located on a quiet street in a small town but that is just what we wanted. We were close to hiking, antique mall, wineries, Wright-Pat AFB..it was a good spot to homebase from and so our mornings and evenings where relaxing at the home and then out enjoying the area.
And Rachel can point you in the right direction for things to do, we appreciated the tips of places to go. Clifton Mill was a great hike and lunch, the wineries we found where fun, The Speakeasy Raman Bar was really cool with great food.
So if you want a get away that will give you an opportunity to rest, reconnect with a loved one or just visit some interesting places this is a great place to stay. We will definitely be back.

review_text: Everything was perfect. The house is clean and cozy, perfect for two people. Love the comfy bed, organized kitchen, snacks & water waiting for us (including supplies to make s'mores), and the rain shower. We took our bicycles and it's just a minute to get to the trailhead. Grocery store is less than a half mile from the house, and so is Green Monkey Pizza, which we recommend. All in Flavor is the best cafe - great food for breakfast & lunch, and treats, but even nicer people. They made us feel welcome. South Charleston is a small town and its location to the bike trail is so convenient. We hope to return soon!

review_text: Cosy, comfortable, clean--that is what Mark's accommodation was. It is sort of off-the-beaten-path but that is precisely what made it so wonderful. The peacefulness was welcomed. We loved that it was so quiet and dark at night (we live in the city and get quite a bit of ambient light and noise). It was very clean. The beds were wonderful as was the bedding. Another plus is how many electrical outlets they had. Most places seem to not have enough or in the right places. The two bedrooms were lovely with wonderful closet space. The heating worked well (it was chilly out). This is a place to chill out, not to party or dine out in fancy restaurants. But if you are wanting to slow down, enjoy nature (it is in a wooded area) and just relax, then this place in this area will please you. Mark was also a responsive host and accommodating.

The house was easy to find in the dark and it was in a safe location tucked away in the countryside where we felt comfortable parking our truck that had a bed full of our fishing equipment in it. Check-in was easy and we were greeted with the sound of peaceful music playing when we stepped inside. After a long day of driving the comfort of the bed we slept on here was so rewarding. We woke up in the morning to the pleasant sound of rain outside and had such a relaxing morning drinking coffee and enjoying the homemade cupcakes that were waiting for us when he had arrived the night before. We really appreciated all of the personal touches here and just how beautiful of a location it was in. Both of us have stayed in quite a bit of Airbnb's and we both agreed that thus far this one has definitely been our favorite. We really hope to stay here again in the future when we are traveling. If you are looking for a super cozy, peaceful and welcoming Airbnb to stay at, this is it!

Stayed one night
review_text:
When I tell you that there are some Airbnb stays that should be classified as luxury. Let me tell you, honey. Mark and Susan gave me a better experience than I just had at a luxury hotel that charged me $300.
First, you walk into the Airbnb to soft classical music playing and the scent of lavender. The space was meticulously decorated, clean, and looked better than the description.
But baby, it is the details that made me never want to leave. It was the fresh cinnamon bread and chocolate chip cookies that were waiting for me. It was the fully stocked coffee and tea station, complete with three kinds of creamer. It was the complimentary water and fresh orange juice. It was the heavenly pillowtop mattress that knocked me out in five minutes.
Oh and I didn't mention the cherry on the top. It was pet-friendly! (I know!) The pets were not allowed into the Airbnb and had to stay in the garage, but ya'll, the garage was the size of half a basketball court, was clean and cool for my dogs. It was so big that my dog and I played fetch! And with no pet fee, I was won over.
I wish I could have stayed longer. Highly recommend.

name: Jamie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2020
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Guest House was in the country, for us this was a bonus. It was only a short drive (about 10 minutes) from city limits of Washington C.H. and about half hour from Circleville or Chillicothe, not much farther to Grove City or Columbus. We drove over an hour to Tar Hollow, that was our longest commute. Anywho, I wish we had more time to sit and enjoy the beautiful foliage on the grounds or go for a brisk stroll because the area really showcases the beauty of rural Ohio, America's heartland (my home state ğŸ˜‰). We were traveling with an infant, and staying in a typical hotel room would have been a nightmare of difficulty and inconvenience. Our baby girl needed room to crawl, play and room with us in a separate room from her big brother so she wasn't waking him up in the middle of the night. The Guest House was like an apartment over a big garage. It was spacious and beautifully setup. Whomever did the decorating, has great taste in my opinion. When we came in there were decorative lights on and soft music playing. It was so warm and welcoming. There was a genuine good energy in that place, something we all needed. There was also home baked pumpkin bread which was THE best I have ever had in my life!! The beds were amazing and soft like a down mattress. There are 2 bedrooms and 1 spare twin bed in a nook in the living room area. All kid tested and approved. I believe we see reminders of God's love and encouragement, in many little things, if we are on the watch for it. The Guest House was full of such little reminders, I'd find one and find comfort. I wouldn't change anything, this was better than any hotel and I would rather invest in good, hard working American folks than a hotel chain. In fact we hope to return on our next trip back home. Thank you Mark and Susan very much for making my baby girls' first trip home (and our stay as well), so comfortable. God bless you both!

They provided baked goods, drinks (milk, juice, coffee, tea), and such a cozy, relaxing environment. The beds were extremely comfortable. We didn't want to get out of them in the morning. The entire place is decorated, as if it came out of a magazine. We didn't have any kids stay with us on this trip (we originally planned on my nephew staying, but he wanted to stay out our Grandpa's house near by), this place is definitely family friendly. It is spacious, the furniture is comfy, and they have a ton of movies, books, and board games to keep you entertained during your down time. My husband and I enjoyed a game of life, while eating the delicious cinnamon bread, one evening. Their property is extremely beautiful, and has a such a warm feel to it. We were welcomed by Mrs. Susan, as soon we pulled up. Check in and out was a breeze, and they were very helpful with any questions we had. We will definitely stay here again in the future. We highly recommend Mark & Susan's place!!!!

So peaceful. If our travels bring us back to this area, and this place is available we would definitely stay here again.

I've stayed in a lot of Airbnb places over the last couple of years, but theirs is the first in my experience to have a guest book, which is one indication among many of their exceptional hospitality. They're also exceptionally thoughtful and accommodating, for example booking us for only two nights rather than the three we requested, because they knew our plans were indefinite. People who wrote in the guest book before me echoed my sentiments: the place is perfect and inspiring. Nobody has ever given them less than five stars and I doubt that anyone ever will. There didn't use to be any Airbnb's in Fayette County, but visitors to the area are now fortunate to have Mark and Susan's at their disposal.

review_text: Amazing spaces (we rented both the barn & the studio)!! Beautiful property surrounded by gorgeous fields, yet only a few minutes to town. We loved the pool & amazing pool house. The barn was super clean (still smells new) & offered a great space for our family & friends dinners. The kids had a blast with ping pong, playing with Nibbles (sweet dog), swimming, making Sâ€™mores by the fire, & playing in the awesome tree house/swing set. Although Karan & Steve live on the property, we felt that it was truly private. They were amazing hosts & helped us find a great restaurant in town as well. I highly recommend both of the spaces!!

review_text: Having never stayed at an AirBnB we were not sure what to expect but this experience was far better than anything we imagined! The barn was beautiful, so cozy and very nicely kept with thoughtful touches that made us feel very welcome. The property overall is such a gem, secluded and quiet, our girls loved the tree house, swing set and the tire swings! The pool area makes you feel like you are at a resort, it is so beautiful, but you still feel at home at the same time. Karan & Steve give you plenty of privacy but we found ourselves hoping to see them because they are a delight to talk to. Our whole family got so excited every time Nibbles & Wilson came running out, such sweet dogs! This was the perfect quiet and relaxing escape from the craziness of 2020!

review_text: My family and I spent a week here and had a great time. My children loved having access to a pool and absolutely loved that it "glowed" at night. We did spend a couple of day trips going to Columbus which was only about an hour away. We also did some nearby outlet shopping and could have gone to an amusement park but the kids had fun at the pool so we skipped the amusement park this trip. Karan and Steve were so nice to talk with. They were always available if we had questions but gave us space to enjoy the property. Their dog, Nibbles was great to have around as well. My oldest was very sad to leave Nibbles behind. We loved having him around. Thank you so much Karan and Steve.
